item.title: My Website
item.description: I had been thinking to have my own website for a while now. Once I decided to stop the procrastination, it just took a couple of hours to get it up and running. I used Hugo, a static site generator written in Go, to set up the site. I was looking for a simple design and the cactus theme looked pretty good to me. I’ve also setup a simple github action to publish the website to github pages!

item.title: About me
item.description: About Me I am a Software Engineer and a Computer Science graduate student at Virginia Tech. Before this, I worked at HackerRank where I worked on various parts of the tech stack from frontend, backend and infrastructure for over 3 years. Some of my major contributions include rewriting the code-checker platform and adding support for intelligent auto-complete based on language server protocol. My complete work profile can be found on LinkedIn.
